column4: I have a Linksys WUSB54Gv2 (WIFI) and instructions for install on Dapper 6.06.  Should they be the same for Edgy?
yep, should be.
thank you.  new to IRC too.
no problem.
check out this page. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Device/Belkin_F5D7050_ver_3000_%28Ralink_rt73_driver%29?highlight=%28rt73%29
that's what I just setup.
email me at dragonfyre13@gmail.com with questions if you need help beyond that.
if I'm not on later.
that shows you how to setup that card. That's the chipset for rt73.
quite likely, that's what your using.
does it show wlan and wmaster?
much appreciated!
for your network interfaces?
do a ifconfig to find out.
i've only checked in device manager and it shws.  I just started the install and wanted 2 c if there was anything special  I'll check config now.
I got to go now, but email me at the address I gave you if you have some questions. Plenty of caveats if you don't know what you are doing with an rt73 chipset on linux.
thanks. i'll give it a try and see whathappens.  thanks for the support!
no problem. I like to help out where I can, and I'll write a howto soon on the boards.
be sure to email me if you have questions. very few people have the information to get it up and running correctly.
I still don't have wep working, but that should be fairly painless. The hard part (driver installation) is behind me.
also note, you can't use network manager to manage the connection. Connection manager (grab it from the forums) works with the rt73 chipset though.
peace
